required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Positive Parenting: Empowering Young Mothers Experiencing Homelessness With a History of Inter-personal Violence to Improve Parenting Strategies
clinical_study.official_title: Positive Parenting: Empowering Young Mothers Experiencing Homelessness With a History of Inter-personal Violence to Improve Parenting Strategies

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to strengthen the skills and self-efficacy of women by addressing the social and emotional trauma that they have experienced from inter-personal violence (IPRV) and homelessness and to promote positive parenting strategies through Play and Learning Strategies (ePALS), an evidence based intervention.

detailed_description.textblock: We propose an intervention that provides counseling and social support to women who have experienced IPRV (Recovering from Intimate partner violence through Strengths and Empowerment (RISE)) and to teach Play and Learning Strategies (ePALS) to improve the well-being of women experiencing homelessness and their children.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Women's parenting stress as assessed by the Parental Stress scale (PSS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: PSS is an 18-item questionnaire and the participants rate each item on a scale ranging from 1 ("strongly disagree") to 5 ("strongly agree"), a higher score indicating more stress

primary_outcome.measure: Change in social support as assessed by the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Item Bank v 2.0 Emotional Support
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: The PROMIS emotional support tool has 16 items and the participants respond each item using a 5-point rating scale from 1(never)-5(always) a higher score indicating more emotional support

primary_outcome.measure: Change in social support as assessed by the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Item Bank v 2.0 Informational Support
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: The PROMIS informational support is a 10 items and participants respond each item using a 5-point rating scale (Health Measures) anchored by 1(never)-5(always) with a higher score indicating a better outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Change in women's empowerment as assessed by the Personal Progress Scale-Revised (PPS-R)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: PPS-R is a 28-item self-report measure on which participants rate the extent to which they agreed or disagreed with each item on a 7-point scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in self efficacy as assessed by the General Self- Efficacy Scale (GSE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: GSE is a 10 item scale. Participants respond to statements such as "I can solve most problems if I invest the necessary effort" on a 4-point Likert scale anchored by 1(not at all true)-4( exactly true),the total score ranges between 10 and 40, with a higher score indicating more self-efficacy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in parent satisfaction as assessed by the Parenting Sense of Competence Scale (PSOC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: The PSOC is a 17-item scale and each item is rated on a 6-point Likert scale anchored by 1(strongly disagree to 6( strongly agree).A higher score indicates a higher parenting sense of competency

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's behavior as assessed by the Devereux Early Childhood Assessments (DECA)-Infant
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: DECA (Infant) is a 33 item questionnaire for parents about their infants (1mont-18 months) It is a 5 point behavior rating scale scored from never to very frequently which provides an assessment of within-child protective factors central to social and emotional health and resilience.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's behavior as assessed by the Devereux Early Childhood Assessments (DECA)-Toddler
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: DECA (Toddler) is a 36 item questionnaire. It is a 5 point behavior rating scale scored from never to very frequently which provides an assessment of within-child protective factors central to social and emotional health and resilience.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's behavior as assessed by the Devereux Early Childhood Assessments (DECA)-Preschoolers
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: DECA (preschoolers) is a 38 item questionnaire. It is a 5 point behavior rating scale scored from never to very frequently which provides an assessment of within-child protective factors central to social and emotional health and resilience.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived parent child connectedness as assessed by the Mothers Object Relational Scale- Short Form (MORS- SF) and MORS- Child scale.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 month post intervention, 3 months post intervention
primary_outcome.description: this is a 14 item scale and each item is scored from 0( never)-5(always)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Recovering from Intimate partner violence through Strengths and Empowerment (RISE) +ePALS

intervention.intervention_name: Recovering from Intimate partner violence through Strengths and Empowerment (RISE)
intervention.description: RISE intervention will be implemented for a period of 4 weeks at the beginning of the program. Four components/modules of the RISE intervention which includes a) education on health effects of violence, b) improving coping and self-care, c) enhancing social support, and d) addressing sexual violence will be used. Toward the beginning of each session the participant will complete a brief survey including a 10-item general self-efficacy scale to be graphed and discussed together to provide more immediate feedback to women about their progress, and at times, inform module selection. At the conclusion of each RISE session, women are asked to set a goal related to the topic in consultation with the clinician
intervention.arm_group_label: Recovering from Intimate partner violence through Strengths and Empowerment (RISE) +ePALS

intervention.description: Participants and their children will then receive 6 weekly sessions of ePALS. The ePALS sessions include rapport building, recognizing and understanding children's signals, contingently responding to signals, labeling objects and actions, learning book reading strategies, maintaining children's focus of attention, helping children with self-regulation, and language scaffolding techniques. Each parent will have a personal parenting coach who remotely supports their progress through the program. After a parent views a PALS coaching session, they will videotape themselves trying the strategy for that week with their child. Then their coach sets up a zoom call and together they talk about the PALS strategy and view the video. The coach facilitates parental appraisal of their behavior and discuss what they thought worked with their child and what they want to do differently.
intervention.arm_group_label: Recovering from Intimate partner violence through Strengths and Empowerment (RISE) +ePALS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women's report of physical, sexual or psychological abuse from a partner/ family member/ acquaintance/ stranger within the last 24 months
- have at least one child under the age of 5 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-English speaking
- physical presence of a male partner at the time of enrollment

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
